H0.text: The processes require egg cells for both sexual and asexual reproduction.

H1.text: New cells are produced is a characteristic of both sexual and asexual reproduction.

H2.text: Two parents are required is a characteristic that applies to both sexual and asexual reproduction.

H3.text: The processes produce genetically unique offspring is a characteristic of both sexual and asexual reproduction.

A5.text: The offspring that arise by asexual reproduction from either unicellular or multicellular organisms inherit the full set of genes of their single parent.

A6.text: In asexual reproduction, an organism can reproduce without the involvement of another organism.

A7.text: By asexual reproduction, an organism creates a genetically similar or identical copy of itself.

A8.text: For simple unicellular microorganisms such as the amoeba, one cell division is equivalent to reproduction â€“ an entire new organism is created.

A9.text: Cell division is the process by which a parent cell divides into two daughter cells.
